channel.name: Cannot convert undefined to a BigInt

embeds.title: cryptomon-deposit/contracts/src/gamedeposit.ts at 401b3600eb2e21a24...

messages.content:
Can you try 
```typescript
UInt64.from(amountMina)
```

If what DFST mentioned doesn't work you can try 

amountMina = BigInt(amount) * BigInt(1000000000) maybe?
And then the conversion to Uint
if I call it with bigint the code crash before
I suspect that the issue could be that you are defining `fee` as an empty `string` instead of as a `number`
Oh yeah this could be it
I put fee : '1' or '0.1' same problem
the app crash on this part :
I think I didn't use the new project ui correctly
anyone has an example of UI with lastest version of zk project ?
Are you putting `1` as a `number` or `'1'` as a `string`?

I tried the 2 possibilities, but the code crash on prove

I think I didn't initiate my app correctly, I didn't use webworker
Mmm, ok, then I don't know why it is failing 🤔
With webworker I didn't have this problem anymore but I need signature from current account how I can achieve it with auro
Couldn't send zkApp command: (invalid "Invalid_signature: [B62qk7R5wo6WTwYSpBHPtfikGvkuasJGEv4ZsSA2sigJdqJqYsWUzA1]")

Not sure what is the cause of the error, but I think you should remove this commented line from your other code, since your `deposit` method already is already using `getAndRequireSignature` to make sure the tx is signed by the sender

Similarly, this line in your contract may be redundant and causing issues (maybe you can use a normal `AccountUpdate.create` instead of `createSigned`
https://github.com/MinaNavigator/cryptomon-deposit/blob/401b3600eb2e21a24d0b85b38600406e4f235767/contracts/src/gamedeposit.ts#L86

messages.content: Oh yeah seems i forget to remove this line XD
Couldn't send zkApp command: (invalid ("Authorization kind does not match the authorization" ((expected Signature) (got None_given))))
If i put await state.zkapp!.requireSignature();
Do you mean that it failed when you removed `await state.zkapp!.requireSignature();`?
I got this error when I put this line
I got an error when I remove it
Couldn't send zkApp command: (invalid "Invalid_signature: [B62qk7R5wo6WTwYSpBHPtfikGvkuasJGEv4ZsSA2sigJdqJqYsWUzA1]")
In my test I sign like this
And this works, correct?
You only get the error when signing from the browser with Auro Wallet?
yes only with auro

It should be async
```typescript
await zkAppGameDeposit.deposit(amount);
```
on the tets ?
in all cases the tests work, it's the ui that's the problem
All SmartContract methods are now async starting with o1js 0.18.0, so `await` should always be used
lol I need to put a lot of await so
have you an example of smartcontract call with wallet sign ?

Are you sure you removed this line from your UI?
https://github.com/MinaNavigator/cryptomon-deposit/blob/401b3600eb2e21a24d0b85b38600406e4f235767/ui/src/pages/index.page.tsx#L58C16-L58C32

messages.content: I suspect that the tx is expecting a signature from the zkAppKey besides the signature from the sender

And unlike in your code where you sign with both (sender and zkAppKey) like this:

```ts
 await txn3.sign([deployerKey, zkAppGameDepositPrivateKey]).send();
```

With Auro, you are only signing with the sender key
the last version https://github.com/MinaNavigator/cryptomon-deposit/blob/360ec2bd30414fe21c199f32ec055669ef1e0d91/ui/src/pages/zkappWorker.ts#L49

embeds.title: cryptomon-deposit/ui/src/pages/zkappWorker.ts at 360ec2bd30414fe21c...
embeds.description: Contribute to MinaNavigator/cryptomon-deposit development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content:
Anothe thing I would do is replacing this line:
https://github.com/MinaNavigator/cryptomon-deposit/blob/401b3600eb2e21a24d0b85b38600406e4f235767/contracts/src/gamedeposit.ts

To:

```ts
let senderUpdate = AccountUpdate.create(senderPublicKey);
```

I don't think it's necessary to use `createSigned` since you are already using `getAndRequireSignature` and that may be creating some weird constraints for the expected signatures

your request

so it need contract private key

messages.content: So actually with auro we cant sign with multiple key
I don't think so, but we can ask @niuniu | Auro Wallet @bulingTang | Auro Wallet (It's kind of an edge case so I wouldn't be surprised if it isn't supported)
Yeah
Testing on the node side is correct, but when use auro throw an error like snap ?

Yea but I think its because it need the app key.
Is it possible to pass the app key for signature

`multiple key` means that the user needs to sign multiple times, or is it like this that multiple key signatures are needed, but the user only needs to sign once (only one of a, b ,c is user)?
  await txn3.sign([a.priKey, b.priKey,c.priKey]).send();

You can first use other private keys to sign, and finally call the auro signature, just like `zkAppPrivateKey` here
https://github.com/aurowallet/test-zkapp/blob/master/ui/src/utils/zkappWorker.ts#L86

messages.content: Yes, I want to sign with user private key and zkapp key like that     await txn3.sign([deployerKey, zkAppGameDepositPrivateKey]).send();

Okay, you can first use zkAppPrivateKey to sign in zkApp
await txn3.sign([zkAppPrivateKey])
After signing, use the signed transaction body as the transaction and call auro to sign with the user privateKey.

Here are some test cases for auro  with zkApp

zkAppWorker sign first
https://github.com/aurowallet/test-zkapp/blob/master/ui/src/utils/zkappWorker.ts#L86

then call auro sign

messages.content: Ok

Hello, when I use o1js 0.18.0 / 1.0.1 to build an update contract action , I directly use `update_txn.sign([deployKeys.privateKey]).send()` and it work well.
 But when I use `mina-signer`(3.0.5) to sign the zkCommond(unsigned) that build by o1js , it will throw Invalid_signature when broadcast. How to solve this? @gregor
Signing tx multiple times is not supported at the moment: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1582

embeds.title: Allow to call Transaction.sign() several times  Issue #1582  o1-l...
embeds.description: Proposal: make it possible to call .sign several times tx.sign([zkAppPrivateKey]); tx.sign([deployer]); It will allow to call the function that signs the tx without disclosing the privateKey: tx.si...

messages.content: For o1js twice, the only problem is that o1js removes its "lazy signature", puts in a dummy signature and doesn't sign again after that

So if mina-signer signature is required, it needs to be executed manually here? 
```
Does i refer to the index of the account that needs to be signed in accountUpdates?
I tried executing it in the update, and it throw Invalid_signature

deploy_txn2.transaction.accountUpdates[i].authorization.signature = undefined;
```
Is this case no longer supported ?
finally I rewrite it with last o1js versions and in one smartcoontract and not 2

Now there are 2 questions
1. How to use mina-signer to sign a transaction that requires only one signature
2. How to use mina-signer to sign the last signed transaction

made two issues
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1622
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1623
These two issues were not created by me 😂
yeah that's true. `JSON.parse(tx.toJSON())` is correct, but (sadly) not type-safe
Hello, I update my contract and ui to need only user signature but I continue to have an error in Auro invalid signature
my code :
Yes, this requires Auro wallet to upgrade the mina-signer version to v3.0.6. we will upgrade as soon
Oh okay thank you, I will pause my dev so and work on other things
Hello, Auro Wallet extension  latest version 2.2.15 has been released.

Ty it's working
